title: IndiAPIs: Access Indian Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
text: IndiAPIs package provides unified interface access open data World Bank API REST Countries API, focus India. allows users retrieve --date historical information topics economic indicators, international demographic statistics, key geopolitical details related India. addition API-access functions, package includes one largest curated collections open datasets focused India. datasets cover wide range topics including population, economy, weather, politics, health, biodiversity, sports, agriculture, cybercrime, infrastructure, . IndiAPIs designed support users working data related India integrating international RESTful APIs structured reliable datasets public, academic, government sources single, easy--use R package.

title: IndiAPIs: Access Indian Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
text: IndiAPIs package provides several core functions access real-time structured information India public APIs World Bank API REST Countries API. list main functions included package: get_india_child_mortality(): Get India’s -5 Mortality Rate World Bank. get_india_cpi(): Get India’s Consumer Price Index (2010 = 100) World Bank. get_india_energy_use(): Get India’s Energy Use (kg oil equivalent per capita) World Bank. get_india_gdp(): Get India’s GDP (current US$) World Bank. get_india_hospital_beds(): Get India’s Hospital Beds (per 1,000 people) World Bank. get_india_life_expectancy(): Get India’s Life Expectancy Birth World Bank. get_india_literacy_rate(): Get India’s Adult Literacy Rate World Bank. get_india_population(): Get India’s Total Population World Bank. get_india_unemployment(): Get India’s Unemployment Rate (% total labor force) World Bank. get_country_info_in(): Get Key Country Information India. view_datasets_IndiAPIs(): View Available Datasets IndiAPIs. functions allow users access high-quality structured information India, can combined tools like dplyr ggplot2 support wide range data analysis, visualization, research tasks. following sections, ’ll find examples work IndiAPIs practical scenarios.

what: IndiAPIs’ GDP (Current US$) from World Bank 2022 - 2017
title: IndiAPIs: Access Indian Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
code: india_gdp <- head(get_india_gdp())  print(india_gdp) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   indicator         country  year   value value_label       #>   <chr>             <chr>   <int>   <dbl> <chr>             #> 1 GDP (current US$) India    2022 3.35e12 3,346,107,287,731 #> 2 GDP (current US$) India    2021 3.17e12 3,167,270,623,260 #> 3 GDP (current US$) India    2020 2.67e12 2,674,851,578,587 #> 4 GDP (current US$) India    2019 2.84e12 2,835,606,256,558 #> 5 GDP (current US$) India    2018 2.70e12 2,702,929,641,649 #> 6 GDP (current US$) India    2017 2.65e12 2,651,474,262,755

what: IndiAPIs’ Life Expectancy at Birth from World Bank 2022 - 2017
title: IndiAPIs: Access Indian Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
code: india_life_expectancy <- head(get_india_life_expectancy())  print(india_life_expectancy) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   indicator                               country  year value #>   <chr>                                   <chr>   <int> <dbl> #> 1 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) India    2022  71.7 #> 2 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) India    2021  67.3 #> 3 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) India    2020  70.2 #> 4 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) India    2019  70.7 #> 5 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) India    2018  70.4 #> 6 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) India    2017  70.1

what: IndiAPIs’ Total Population from World Bank 2022 - 2017
title: IndiAPIs: Access Indian Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
code: india_population <- head(get_india_population())  print(india_population) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   indicator         country  year      value value_label   #>   <chr>             <chr>   <int>      <int> <chr>         #> 1 Population, total India    2022 1425423212 1,425,423,212 #> 2 Population, total India    2021 1414203896 1,414,203,896 #> 3 Population, total India    2020 1402617695 1,402,617,695 #> 4 Population, total India    2019 1389030312 1,389,030,312 #> 5 Population, total India    2018 1374659064 1,374,659,064 #> 6 Population, total India    2017 1359657400 1,359,657,400

title: IndiAPIs: Access Indian Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # Calculate average prices by city city_avg <- GoldPricesIndia_df %>%   mutate(     Chennai_Avg = (Chennai_Low + Chennai_High) / 2,     Kolkatta_Avg = (Kolkatta_Low + Kolkatta_High) / 2,     Bangalore_Avg = (Bangalore_Low + Bangalore_High) / 2,     Madurai_Avg = (Madurai_Low + Madurai_High) / 2,     Hyderabad_Avg = (Hyderabad_Low + Hyderabad_High) / 2,     Delhi_Avg = (Delhi_Low + Delhi_High) / 2,     Month = factor(Month, levels = c("Feb", "Mar", "Apr", "May", "Jun",                                      "Jul", "Aug", "Sep", "Oct", "Nov", "Dec", "Jan"))   )  # Create the plot ggplot(city_avg, aes(x = Month)) +   geom_line(aes(y = Chennai_Avg, color = "Chennai", group = 1)) +   geom_line(aes(y = Kolkatta_Avg, color = "Kolkatta", group = 1)) +   geom_line(aes(y = Bangalore_Avg, color = "Bangalore", group = 1)) +   geom_line(aes(y = Madurai_Avg, color = "Madurai", group = 1)) +   geom_line(aes(y = Hyderabad_Avg, color = "Hyderabad", group = 1)) +   geom_line(aes(y = Delhi_Avg, color = "Delhi", group = 1)) +   labs(title = "Gold Prices Across Indian Cities",        x = "Month",        y = "Average Price (INR)",        color = "City") +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

title: IndiAPIs: Access Indian Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
text: dataset IndiAPIs labeled suffix indicate structure type: _df: standard data frame object. _dt: data table object. _ts: time series object.

title: IndiAPIs: Access Indian Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
text: addition API access functions, IndiAPIs offers one largest curated collections open datasets focused India. preloaded datasets cover wide range topics including population, economy, weather, politics, health, biodiversity, sports, agriculture, cybercrime, infrastructure, . featured examples: BurdwanWeather_df: data frame containing weekly weather data rice growing season Burdwan district West Bengal, India. birds_watching_tbl_df: tibble containing detailed information bird species observed India, including species names, scientific names, date last observation. DelhiPotatoPrices_ts: time series containing monthly average potato prices Delhi market January 2010 July 2020.

title: IndiAPIs: Access Indian Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
text: IndiAPIs package offers unified interface accessing real-time data public APIs rich collection curated datasets India. Covering wide range topics economic indicators, international demographic geopolitical statistics via global APIs, detailed datasets population, economy, weather, politics, health, biodiversity, sports, agriculture, cybercrime, infrastructure, , IndiAPIs provides users reliable, structured, high-quality data. Unlike tools focus exclusively API access, IndiAPIs includes one comprehensive collections preloaded open datasets related India, enabling deeper exploration country’s historical, social, economic landscape. Designed support reproducible research, education, data journalism, package empowers users analyze visualize India-focused data directly within R, using tidy data formats well-documented sources.

title: Access Indian Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # Load the package  library(IndiAPIs)  # Retrieves essential information about India  get_country_info_in()  # Get India's Population (Total) from World Bank  get_india_population()  # Load a dataset  data(India_census2011_tbl_df)  # Shows six rows of the dataset  head(India_census2011_tbl_df)  # Display the structure of the dataset  str(India_census2011_tbl_df)  # Shows the whole dataset  View(India_census2011_tbl_df)

title: CyberCrime in India — CyberCrime_India_tbl_df
text: dataset, CyberCrime_India_tbl_df, tibble containing cybercrime statistics across Indian cities. includes counts various types cybercrimes personal revenge, anger, fraud, extortion, causing disrepute, prank, sexual exploitation, disruption public service, illegal drug sales, business development, piracy spreading, psychological offenses, information theft, abetment suicide, others, along total number cases. dataset preserves original structure source Kaggle.

what: Get Country Information for India — get_country_info_in
title: Get Country Information for India — get_country_info_in
text: Retrieves comprehensive country information India REST Countries API. function fetches data including official common names, geographical information, capital, area, population, languages.

title: Get Country Information for India — get_country_info_in
Get Country Information for India — get_country_info_in
text: tibble one row containing India's country information: name_common Common name country name_official Official name country region Geographic region subregion Geographic subregion capital Capital city(ies) area Total area square kilometers population Total population languages Languages spoken (comma-separated)

title: Get Country Information for India — get_country_info_in
text: function makes request REST Countries API v3.1 endpoint specifically India using full text search. handles API errors gracefully returns NULL request fails data found.

title: Get Country Information for India — get_country_info_in
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get India information in_info <- get_country_info_in() print(in_info) } # }

what: Get India's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_india_child_mortality
title: Get India's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_india_child_mortality
text: Retrieves India's -5 mortality rate, measured number deaths children five years age per 1,000 live births, years 2010 2022 using World Bank Open Data API. indicator used SH.DYN.MORT.

title: Get India's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_india_child_mortality
Get India's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_india_child_mortality
text: World Bank Open Data API: https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SH.DYN.MORT

title: Get India's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_india_child_mortality
text: tibble following columns: indicator: Indicator name (e.g., "Mortality rate, -5 (per 1,000 live births)") country: Country name ("India") year: Year data (integer) value: Mortality rate (per 1,000 live births)

title: Get India's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_india_child_mortality
text: function sends GET request World Bank API. API request fails returns error status code, function returns NULL informative message.

title: Get India's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_india_child_mortality
text: Requires internet connection.

title: Get India's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_india_child_mortality

what: Get India's Energy Use (kg of oil equivalent per capita) from World Bank — get_india_energy_use
title: Get India's Energy Use (kg of oil equivalent per capita) from World Bank — get_india_energy_use
text: Retrieves India's energy use per capita, measured kilograms oil equivalent, years 2010 2022 using World Bank Open Data API. indicator used EG.USE.PCAP.KG.OE.

title: Get India's Energy Use (kg of oil equivalent per capita) from World Bank — get_india_energy_use
Get India's Energy Use (kg of oil equivalent per capita) from World Bank — get_india_energy_use
text: World Bank Open Data API: https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/EG.USE.PCAP.KG.OE

title: Get India's Energy Use (kg of oil equivalent per capita) from World Bank — get_india_energy_use
text: tibble following columns: indicator: Indicator name (e.g., "Energy use (kg oil equivalent per capita)") country: Country name ("India") year: Year data (integer) value: Energy use per capita (kg oil equivalent)

title: Get India's Energy Use (kg of oil equivalent per capita) from World Bank — get_india_energy_use
text: function sends GET request World Bank API. API request fails returns error status code, function returns NULL informative message.

title: Get India's Energy Use (kg of oil equivalent per capita) from World Bank — get_india_energy_use
text: Requires internet connection.

title: Get India's Energy Use (kg of oil equivalent per capita) from World Bank — get_india_energy_use

what: IndiAPIs: Access Indian Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets — IndiAPIs
title: IndiAPIs: Access Indian Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets — IndiAPIs
text: package provides functions access data public RESTful APIs including 'World Bank API', 'REST Countries API', retrieving real-time historical data related India, economic indicators, international demographic geopolitical indicators. Additionally, package includes one largest curated collections open datasets focused India, covering topics population, economy, weather, politics, health, biodiversity, sports, agriculture, cybercrime, infrastructure, .
